attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:

skillTree.localised_description: Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

skillTree.localised_description: Nekaph was a formidable man in life, renowned for his powerful physique and uncompromising sense of duty. Even unarmed, Nekaph was deadly, and he could cave in the skulls of his opponent's with a single blow of his fist.
Rulers of nations quake with fear as Nekaph demands their fealty, and they realise that their doom has arrived.

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +35% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Though his jaw does not move, and no discernible sound ushers from his lipless mouth, Nekaph's trembling foes hear a deep voice echoing in their heads.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Nekaph's strength, feats of skill and unswerving loyalty to his king were unsurpassed. Nekaph distinguished himself in battle time and again, and before his eighteenth year he was inducted into the prestigious ranks of the elite Tomb Guard. Within two years, Nekaph had risen to command Settra's royal guard, and soon after he was appointed as his personal herald, for there was no more incorruptible a warrior in all of Nehekhara.
Leading from the front, Nekaph advances towards his foes, cleaving them asunder. As the bodies of the enemy stack up and the Undead legions continue their implacable advance.
It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

Though he slew many enemies at the behest of Settra, it was only when he fought duels on behalf of his king that the Herald Nekaph's true warrior potential was reached, for he would fight all the harder knowing that the honour of his lord was at stake – something far more important than his own life. Nekaph would deflect the blows of his opponent with consummate skill before delivering a fatal blow of his own.

target_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit: death.
Full-plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
The defenders realise the futility of their resistance – but the Herald Nekaph shows no mercy. The time for surrender has long since passed...

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

items.colour_text: As a mark of Settra's trust in his chosen champion, Nekaph was gifted the Flail of Skulls - an unmistakable symbol of Settra's power and a weapon that the ruler of Khemri himself once wielded on the field of battle.

backgroundSkills.localised_description:
All soldiers of Khemri know that when Nekaph is in battle the word of the one true king is with them. Leading from the front, the constant exaltation of their great king by Nekaph inspires all Nehekharan soldiers.
	 
	"Kneel before the might of 
	Settra the Imperishable,
	Khemrikhara, King of Nehekhara, 
	Lord of the Earth,
	Monarch of the Sky, 
	Ruler of the Four Horizons.
	Mighty Lion of the Infinite Desert. 
	Great Hawk of the Heavens, 
	Majestic Emperor of the Shifting Sands.
	Eternal Sovereign of Khemri's Legions....."
	 
	- The opening few lines of Nekaph's 
	speech demanding his
	foe's unconditional surrender.
